abstract: The stage version of the Oscar-winning film will tour in Britain first.
snippet: The stage version of the Oscar-winning film will tour in Britain first.

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: George VI, King of Great Britain

lead_paragraph: A stage version of "The King's Speech," the film that won the Academy Award for best picture this year, is no longer on a fast track to Broadway, as its author and one of its producers had originally envisioned. The play by David Seidler, who won an Oscar for best original screenplay for the film, will have a world-premiere production in February in Guildford, England, and then tour theaters in five other British cities through mid-March, according to the producers. A London production of the play may follow, according to a spokesman for the show, and Broadway remains a possibility.

headline.main: A Detour on Road to Broadway for 'The King's Speech'
